column4: what is wrong with this fstab line"/dev/sda5       /media/sda5     vfat    defaults,users,rw 0      0
I have a fat32 partition on sda5 and I can't even mount it with root
what happens when you try to sudo mount it?
I can't even mount it with root "sokuban@Arche:~$ sudo mount /media/sda5
you would need to specify the filesystem type in that mount command
I'll take a look at that thanks, (But I thought I put vfat)
and make sure that you sudo mkdir /media/sda5 prior to mounting the device.
Did that, and I did sudo chown sokuban
well you don't need to chown the owner of /media/sda5
You do if you want the user to write and mount it right?
yeah i guess
but once root mounts there it may change the owner back.
thats fstab trying to mount it and erroring out
yes, but when I copy the command from the tutorial, and change it to sda5 it still has the same error
sudo fdisk -l         see if /dev/sda5 is showing up there.
yes, it shows it there '/dev/sda5            5857        7132    10249438+   b  W95 FAT32
okay try sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sda5 /media/sda5
doesn't work
-t fat    ???  can't remember the correct switch  or man mount to read the documentation
yeha mount -t vfat   should work.  Are you sure the partition is okay?
err, "mount: unknown filesystem type 'fat'
I am not sure the partition is ok. I made it with Gparted on the ubuntu live CD, it is a logical partition, I never touched it with windows.
I would check it out in gparted make sure it got formated properly
ok, I'll take a look.
